metadata.title: CVE-2016-2226 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the string_appends function in cplus-dem.c in libibertyallows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted executable,which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1
valgrind-mpi - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

ht - 2.1.0+repack1-1
No subscription required

gdb - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdb-multiarch - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdb-source - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
gdbserver - 7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

binutils - 2.28-3ubuntu1

criterions.comment: valgrind package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1').
ht package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
gcc-h8300-hms package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
binutils package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.28-3ubuntu1').
